Land2Plant

Land2Plant is a startup I have cofounded together with my three colleagues from studies. We aim to create an international crowdfunding platform, which connects land-owners who want to rent out their properties with citizens who want to invest in a safe and sustainable way. The startup has won several prizes and has been part of several startup incubators. It was an entrepreneurship journey which has taught me a lot. Tons of invested hours, rewarded with business, marketing, finance, law and communication skills one can't simply learn at school.

The Deal

Throughout the project we learned techniques how to develop simple yet attractive business plans. Our plan was based on a platform model, in which Land2Plant engages with two main stakeholders: landowners and investors (the crowd):

  • landowners provide land, investors providide capital,
  • Land2Plant investigates project proposals, chooses the most suitable land, designs the power plant and manages the build,
  • investors receive up to 7% ROI,
  • landowners receive part of the money generated from energy sells,
  • Land2Plant charges up to 20% comissions fee at the start of the project.

    •
    Financial Model

    We developed a robust financial plan, with financial projection for the nearest years. The plan was based on a realistic upscaling plan for our power plants, as well as on assumptions for the annual invested capital. These were determined through an exhaustive benchmarking of our competitors. Naturally, we have also included all fixed and variable expanses. The key challanges which we overcame:

  • making a thorough market research,
  • getting familiar with fixed and variable costs for a bussiness,
  • estimating costs of permits and legal help,
  • making upscaling plans for technical projects, marketing, hiring.

    •
    Investor Readiness

    In order to improve data quality and balance the dataset, I have compared numerous preprocessing techniques and applied the best-performing one. The techniques included:

  • change of performance metrics to Precision&Recall,
  • resampling the data (eg. undersampling and oversampling),
  • generating synthetic data (eg. SMOTE or kNN-SMOTE),
  • trying cost-evaluated or penalized models.

    •
    Awards

    Our startup has won multiple awards. The journey began by winning the 3rd place at the european finals of EDPR University Challange 2019, having been selected by EDPR Renewables from over 100 ideas. We were then selected to pitch during the global finals. We also achieved the 1st place on the polish EPAE Conferense in the startups cathegory. Then, we were awarded 2nd place during Entreprenourship Journey organized by EIT Innoenergy. Each of these event has taught us how to better communicate bussiness and technical ideas to investors. We mastered out pitching and networking skills, both of which are also important in daily life.
